Summary Technology Evangelist ~ Engineering, Business, and Innovation Leader 
 
Results-oriented executive offering a powerful combination of business skills and a solid technical background derived from 20+ years of business and engineering experience in domestic and international markets. 
 
* Highly respected leader and accomplished mentor of cross-functional and partner teams with cultural sensitivity and awareness gained from extensive worldwide business travel. Fluent in Russian. 
* Actively promotes and enhances effective communication to manage ambiguity, initiate projects, drive change, and obtain buy-in. 
* Successful track record of driving advanced hardware/software product and platform launches. 
* Enables revenue growth with the profound ability to accelerate customer adoption of new technologies. 
* Strong technical background as a senior engineer and manufacturing process quality leader. 
* Easily grasps business, technical, and technological concepts as demonstrated by the breadth of experience. 
 
 
AREAS OF EXPERTISE

Partner technology included latest offerings in storage, graphics, display, camera, video, audio, and communications. 
* Developed and executed storage IHV ecosystem marketing plans for new industry standard M.2 SSD devices validated on Intel platforms. Resulted in acceleration by up to two platform generations of adoption and transition from mSATA to M.2 form-factor storage devices in mobile and desktop platforms. 
* Organized seminars and webinars for all tiers of storage IHVs to align storage product development to Intel platform capabilities. Sr. Mobile Technology Evangelist Intel Corporation 2004  –  2006  (2 years) San Francisco Bay Area * Defined new usage models in digital home and digital enterprise and delivered collateral and PR material for new business deals and alliances for concept mobile platforms. Led cross-functional teams and engaged partners and creative agencies to deliver and showcase concept demonstration vehicles. 
* Led a cross-functional and inter-company evangelization plan for a small form-factor mobile computer--precursor to tablets--to show vision of both Intel and Land Rover for the detachable infotainment system; and to showcase the vehicle at various venues. Engaged with Jaguar Land Rover, IDEO, and Gregory Cowley Studios to deliver PC integration into LR3 vehicle and PR material. 
* Drove demo strategy, contents, and technology showcases in support of Intel PC Client Group's focus directions: Mobility Innovation Demo Day (MIDD), domestic and international Intel Developer Forum (IDF), and Intel Roadmap Update Meeting (IRUM). Created and presented material to the senior management and IRUM and industry forums. Used fluency in Russian language to support demos and present classes at IDF Moscow. Mobile Platform Technology Marketing Manager; Marketing Platform Manager Intel Corporation 2000  –  2004  (4 years) San Francisco Bay Area * Accelerated by up to two platform generations adoption and transition to new standard form factors, ExpressCard technology, in mobile platforms by initiating and driving the execution of marketing plans. Engaged customers to integrate ExpressCard connectors into systems and collaborated with ExpressCard vendors to ensure availability of devices for customers'​ system launch. 
* Initiated the action to prevent a marketing failure with a multi-million dollar revenue impact by identifying the market acceptance issue. Analyzed and provided critical data to justify the end-of-life of Intel's first foray into fully-integrated CPU for mobile PCs. 
* Achieved market adoption of the Intel Centrino mobile technology by developing collateral for OEMs, end users, and field sales. Promoted the platform wireless communications, security, and extended battery life capabilities to customers and industry forums. 
* Drove class and demo strategy, contents, and technology showcases in support of domestic and international Intel Developer Forum (IDF). Business Development and Customer Program Manager, OEM Sales Group Trident Microsystems 1997  –  2000  (3 years) San Francisco Bay Area * Initiated and developed business for use of audio processor with a key customer (IGT) in the gaming video machine industry. 
* Achieved over 20% annual revenue increase rate of the Trident OEM program. 
* Provided sales forecast for OEM business. Collected, interpreted, negotiated, and drove the implementation of customers' business and technical requirements. 
* Ensured on-time delivery of product samples and software. Successfully directed factory efforts to resolve outstanding compatibility, delivery, and product quality issues throughout the product lifecycle. Senior Corporate Quality Assessor; Fab Quality Systems Manager Intel Corporation 1989  –  1997  (8 years) San Francisco Bay Area * Established Intel D2 Quality Management System (QMS) based on the principles of Total Quality Management (TQM). Transferred QMS to Intel fabs, assembly, and test sites worldwide resulting in the ISO 9000 registration for Intel manufacturing facilities. Led cross-functional QMS team with up to 35 members. 
* Assessed suppliers' quality systems and consulted them on meeting Intel requirements. 
* Delivered to employees Intel University courses on quality systems, quality management, and statistical software use and programming.
